title: PytagoraZ
author: PytagoraZ
content: Excuse me, I have a question that has been bothering me since last night. I don't know where this thought came fromWhat happens if I distrust the default trust?Can I add the same person to the untrusted list? does it have any effect?Pictures are just examples. Not referring to anyone. If you object, please contact disclaimer

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: Quote from: PytagoraZ on July 08, 2023, 01:34:03 AMExcuse me, I have a question that has been bothering me since last night. I don't know where this thought came fromWhat happens if I distrust the default trust?Yes, nothing, you just distrust it.Quote from: PytagoraZ on July 08, 2023, 01:34:03 AMCan I add the same person to the untrusted list? does it have any effect?It's still has the same effect, distrusting a user means you distrust him/er regardless how many times you put the same username with a tilde.

comments.author: Little Mouse
comments.body: Quote from: PytagoraZ on July 08, 2023, 01:34:03 AMWhat happens if I distrust the default trust?Default trust are the people whose feedbacks are visible to everyone by default who don't have a trust list. If you distrust default trust, that means you are not trusting feedbacks of them. In general, you won't see any feedback other than you. You will only see the feedback/s which you have left. Look at my trust network when I distrusted DT.

comments.author: Husires
comments.body: Quote from: PytagoraZ on July 08, 2023, 01:34:03 AMExcuse me, I have a question that has been bothering me since last night. I don't know where this thought came fromWhat happens if I distrust the default trust?When you do not trust the default trust, this means that you trust your trust list without any interference with the default trust, but this will not change the trust that others see.In the sense that if you untrust default trust and some DT1/2 member, the negative trust that he left on you will not appear to you, but it will appear to all community and to new users who trust in the default trust by default.this is a good topic to learn about trust  LoyceV's Beginners guide to correct use of the Trust system

comments.author: PytagoraZ
comments.body: ok thanks for all the attention. I think I've caught the important point. I will lock this thread
